docs.text: Welcome to Trove About Trove is a collection of links to practical, hands-on FHIR Terminology and SNOMED CT resources. ECL Examples are largely drawn from the SNOMED Expression Constraint Language Examples , which is an open source starter set for learning ECL. Glossary ECL (Expression Constraint Language) is a formal, declarative language for defining precise, computable subsets of clinical meanings within SNOMED CT, allowing rich querying and constraint definition for tasks like restricting EHR data, building value sets (e.g., for FHIR), and defining reference sets by specifying relationships and attributes between concepts. ECL expressions are executable rules that define intensional sets, enabling powerful data analysis and interoperability by precisely identifying groups of related clinical concepts. Intensional value set defines a group of SNOMED CT concepts using a logical rule or algorithm, rather than listing every single code, allowing it to dynamically update as new codes are added. For example, a 'Diabetes ValueSet' could be defined as "all descendants of the 'Diabetes' concept". Extensional value set a predefined, explicit list of specific concepts in a value set. The value set can only contain those enumerated values in the expansion. The value set expansion cannot change without redefining the logical definition of the valueset. For example a 'Gender Identity ValueSet' might contain explicitly stated concepts for 'Female gender identity', 'Male gender identity' and 'Non-binary gender identity'. Links ECL (Expression Constraint Language) What is ECL? - The definitive SNOMED International documentation Shrimp ECL Builder - SNOMED CT ECL Builder tool shipped with Ontoserver Terminology Server ECL Builder - A UI to build ECL expressions from CSIRO AEHRC ECL Expression Tester - A repository of testable ECL expressions by myself SNOMED Expression Constraint Language Examples - Examples of SNOMED CT ECL expressions produced by SNOMED International ECL Formatter - A tool to make ECL expressions more readable by Matt Cordell from CSIRO AEHRC
docs.title: Home

docs.text: ECL (Expression Constraint Language) is a formal, declarative language for defining precise, computable subsets of clinical meanings within SNOMED CT, allowing rich querying and constraint definition for tasks like restricting EHR data, building value sets (e.g., for FHIR), and defining reference sets by specifying relationships and attributes between concepts. ECL expressions are executable rules that define intensional sets, enabling powerful data analysis and interoperability by precisely identifying groups of related clinical concepts. Intensional value set defines a group of SNOMED CT concepts using a logical rule or algorithm, rather than listing every single code, allowing it to dynamically update as new codes are added. For example, a 'Diabetes ValueSet' could be defined as "all descendants of the 'Diabetes' concept". Extensional value set a predefined, explicit list of specific concepts in a value set. The value set can only contain those enumerated values in the expansion. The value set expansion cannot change without redefining the logical definition of the valueset. For example a 'Gender Identity ValueSet' might contain explicitly stated concepts for 'Female gender identity', 'Male gender identity' and 'Non-binary gender identity'.

docs.text: About Me I am Michael Osborne, a self-confessed terminology nerd. I've been working with health terminology since the early 2000's when I moved from Medical Laboratory Scientist to lab system development and configuration. Professional Background Since 2023, I've been employed at CSIRO AEHRC to work on terminology artifacts in FHIR Implementation Guides for the Sparked FHIR Accelerator project. Expertise My main expertise is with Pathology and Radiology systems, HL7 V2 and FHIR. I've been on the SNOMED International Content Committee and Modeling Advisory Group. I've contributed to LOINC and have been a LOINC mapper and user since 2001. I also frequent the FHIR chat forum, Zulip . Interests I'm passionate about using terminology servers to improve terminology usability. Terminology servers give you a single approach to managing and utilising SNOMED CT and other code systems. Contact Email LinkedIn Zulip

docs.text: ECL Examples This page contains examples of Expression Constraint Language (ECL) expressions used in SNOMED CT. Basic Examples 1.1 Self Reference to a specific concept by its identifier. 404684003 |clinical finding| 1.2 Descendant Of Matches all descendants of the specified concept. < 404684003 |clinical finding| 1.3 Descendant Or Self Of Matches the concept itself and all its descendants. << 73211009 |diabetes mellitus| 1.4 Ancestor Of Matches all ancestors of the specified concept. > 40541001 |acute pulmonary edema| 1.5 Ancestor Or Self Of Matches the concept itself and all its ancestors. >> 40541001|acute pulmonary edema| 1.6 Member Of Matches all concepts that are members of the specified reference set. ^ 700043003 |example problem list concepts reference set | 1.7 Any Matches any concept in SNOMED CT. * 1.8 Child Of Matches the direct children of the specified concept. <! 404684003 |clinical finding| 1.9 Parent Of Matches the direct parents of the specified concept. >! 40541001 |acute pulmonary edema| Intermediate Examples 2.1 Attribute Specifies a constraint with a single attribute and value. < 19829001 |disorder of lung|: 116676008 |associated morphology| = 79654002 |edema| 2.2 Attribute Group Groups multiple attributes together, where all attributes in a group must be satisfied together. < 404684003 |clinical finding|: { 363698007 |finding site| = << 39057004 |pulmonary valve structure|, 116676008 |associated morphology| = << 415582006 |stenosis| }, { 363698007 |finding site| = << 53085002 |right ventricular structure|, 116676008 |associated morphology| = << 56246009 |hypertrophy| } 2.3 Term Filter Filters concepts by matching disease Causative agents and a text Term filter (< 64572001 |Disease| . 246075003 | Causative agent |) {{ term = "Staph" }} 2.4 Body Structure Left References all left-sided body structure concepts <123037004 | Body structure | : 272741003 | Laterality | = 7771000 | Left | 2.6 Attribute Constraint Operator Constrains attribute values using operators like descendant-or-self. << 404684003 |clinical finding|: << 47429007 |associated with| = << 267038008 |edema| 2.7 Any Attribute Name Value Uses wildcard to match any attribute with a specific value. < 404684003 |clinical finding|: * = 79654002 |edema| 2.8 Dotted Attributes Chains attributes together using dot notation to navigate through nested relationships. < 91723000 |Anatomical structure| AND ( < 125605004 |Fracture of bone| . 363698007 |Finding site| )
docs.title: ECL Examples

docs.text: This page contains examples of Expression Constraint Language (ECL) expressions used in SNOMED CT.
docs.title: ECL Examples

docs.text: Reference to a specific concept by its identifier. 404684003 |clinical finding|
docs.title: 1.1 Self

docs.text: Matches all descendants of the specified concept. < 404684003 |clinical finding|
docs.title: 1.2 Descendant Of

docs.text: Matches the concept itself and all its descendants. << 73211009 |diabetes mellitus|
docs.title: 1.3 Descendant Or Self Of

docs.text: Matches all ancestors of the specified concept. > 40541001 |acute pulmonary edema|
docs.title: 1.4 Ancestor Of

docs.text: Matches the concept itself and all its ancestors. >> 40541001|acute pulmonary edema|
docs.title: 1.5 Ancestor Or Self Of

docs.text: Matches all concepts that are members of the specified reference set. ^ 700043003 |example problem list concepts reference set |
docs.title: 1.6 Member Of

docs.text: Matches any concept in SNOMED CT. *
docs.title: 1.7 Any

docs.text: Matches the direct children of the specified concept. <! 404684003 |clinical finding|
docs.title: 1.8 Child Of

docs.text: Matches the direct parents of the specified concept. >! 40541001 |acute pulmonary edema|
docs.title: 1.9 Parent Of

docs.text: Specifies a constraint with a single attribute and value. < 19829001 |disorder of lung|: 116676008 |associated morphology| = 79654002 |edema|
docs.title: 2.1 Attribute

docs.text: Groups multiple attributes together, where all attributes in a group must be satisfied together. < 404684003 |clinical finding|: { 363698007 |finding site| = << 39057004 |pulmonary valve structure|, 116676008 |associated morphology| = << 415582006 |stenosis| }, { 363698007 |finding site| = << 53085002 |right ventricular structure|, 116676008 |associated morphology| = << 56246009 |hypertrophy| }
docs.title: 2.2 Attribute Group

docs.text: Filters concepts by matching disease Causative agents and a text Term filter (< 64572001 |Disease| . 246075003 | Causative agent |) {{ term = "Staph" }}
docs.title: 2.3 Term Filter

docs.text: References all left-sided body structure concepts <123037004 | Body structure | : 272741003 | Laterality | = 7771000 | Left |
docs.title: 2.4 Body Structure Left

docs.text: Constrains attribute values using operators like descendant-or-self. << 404684003 |clinical finding|: << 47429007 |associated with| = << 267038008 |edema|
docs.title: 2.6 Attribute Constraint Operator

docs.text: Uses wildcard to match any attribute with a specific value. < 404684003 |clinical finding|: * = 79654002 |edema|
docs.title: 2.7 Any Attribute Name Value

docs.text: Chains attributes together using dot notation to navigate through nested relationships. < 91723000 |Anatomical structure| AND ( < 125605004 |Fracture of bone| . 363698007 |Finding site| )
